bits.description: The value of the nBits field in the block header, indicating the target threshold this block’s header had to pass

chain_work.description: The estimated number of block header hashes miners had to check from the genesis block to this block, encoded as big-endian hex.

confirmations.description: The number of confirmations the transactions in this block have, starting at 1 when this block is at the tip of the best block chain. This score will be -1 if the the block is not part of the best block chain.

difficulty.description: The estimated amount of work done to find this block relative to the estimated amount of work done to find block 0.

height.description: The height of this block on its block chain.

hash_as_number.description: Integer representation of a block hash.

median_time.description: UTC datetime of the median block time, i.e. 2019-05-01T00:00:00

merkle_root.description: The reference to a Merkle tree collection which is a hash of all transactions related to this block.

next_block_hash.description: The hash of the next block on the best block chain, if known, encoded as hex in RPC byte order.

next_block_hash_as_number.description: Integer representation of the next block.

nonce.description: The nonce used to generate this block… to allow variations of the header and compute different hashes.

prev_block_hash.description: The hash value of the previous block this particular block references.

prev_block_hash_as_number.description: The integer value of the previous block this particular block references.

size.description: The size of this block in serialized block format, counted in bytes.

time.description: UTC datetime recording when this block was created.

transaction_count.description: The count of transactions in this block.

version_hex.description: This block's version formatted in hexadecimal.

weight.description: This block's weight as defined in BIP141.

auxpow.description: Auxiliary Proof-of-Work (POW). If the block is merge-minded
